text.title: part9_Dr. Joseph Merlino on sexuality, insanity, Freud, fetishes and apathy

p.s: I ca n't say based upon my practice ;

I keep a very small
talking
practice , because of my other work .

Based on my own personal engagement with the outside world , I think people are very frustrated , annoyed , mistrustful , and non-believing of anything government says , but not to the point of doing anything about it .

s.hi: DS : What do you mean when you say ' doing anything about it ' ?

p.s: Being activists about it .
I do n't know if it 's learned helplessness or what .

There 's
apathy
.

One of the most energized moments I experienced in years was when there were the large protests of marchers down the east side to the
U.N.
I long for the play
Hair
to come back .
It 's 40 years old now .

I do n't understand why it 's not back on
Broadway
.

hi.s: DS : We have been in this war for four years .
Is it important to discuss it ?

p.s: I think a lot of us lead more and more isolated existences in the midst of millions of people .
We 're on our cell phone .
We 're on our Blackberry .
We 're on our computer .
It 's all disjointed in some kind of a way .

s.hi: DS : Do you think people are putting their heads in the sand , or do you think it is too much for people to process what is happening ?

p.s: I think people feel impotent .

Look , people came out and did
this massive election
, turned over Congress , the House , the Senate , and nothing has changed .
I think people are feeling that if the vote is the thing is going to change society , and it 's not even doing that ...
Or you have to be a multi-millionaire to run for the office .
With a clean record -- who has that ?
The jury system , and mistrust of that of whether it is bought off , who gets justice and who does n't get justice .

s.hi: DS : But we respond to it .

p.s: Until the Mets lose a game , and then we are on to that .
We are trained to have very short attention spans .
We have become isolated and disjointed from one another , except when we have to mix .

s.hi: DS : How do you think that affects personality development , that our interactions today are so two-dimensional ?

p.s: It affects a lot of things .
Relationships , how we get along with each other .
You look at something like 9/11 or a disaster , and how that galvanizes and brings people together and how short-lived that is .
Then it goes back down again .
It 's as if we constantly need a jolt of that magnitude to shake us out of our complacency in the ways we live and interact .
I think it 's sad , and it 's a concern .
